title: 50 Cent’s dramatic weight changes as he bulks up for drug kingpin role
text:
From one extreme to the other (Picture: 50 Cent, Twitter, Instagram)

50 Cent may be a goof with his trolling on Instagram but what he does take seriously is his powerful movie roles.

The Power star surprised fans this week when he revealed his new bulked up physique after gaining 15 pounds to play drug kingpin Isaac Wright Jr for his forthcoming TV series For Life.

But it’s certainly not the first time 50 has sacrificed his diet to deliver a convincing performance.

Many might have forgotten but back in 2010, the In Da Club rapper dropped a significant amount of amount of weight for his role as a football player battling cancer in the film Things Fall Apart.

His appearance was drastically different and by the sounds of it, his diet was pretty gruelling as the rapper went from 214 pounds to 160 in just nine weeks after adopting a liquid diet, and running on a treadmill for three hours a day.

Ironically, we were actually introduced to 50 through his In Da Club music video, which showed him running on the treadmill and pumping iron in the gym.

Speaking to the Associated Press about his dedication to the cause, the 44-year-old said: ‘This time it was a lot tougher for me.

50 Cent lost a significant amount of weight to play a football player battling cancer (Picture: 50 Cent, Twitter)

The rapper admitted he didn’t expect to win awards for his efforts (Picture: 50 Cent, Twitter)

‘I had to discipline myself not … to actually have myself be in the physical state to convey the energy I felt. It’s a passion project for me.’

At the time, 50 admitted he didn’t expect to win any awards or accolades for his efforts in losing weight to portray the cancer patient.

He said: ‘Well, you know, I haven’t received accolades that comes with the success that I’ve had in music. It would be a surprise [to win].’

But he did find comfort in the fact that other actors had literally dedicated their body to their art, and used their experiences for research.

We’re guessing Christian Bale’s shocking transformation for The Machinist was top of the list.

Fast forward to nine years later and Fiddy is actually putting on the pounds.

The Candy Shop rapper shared an Instagram photo of him on the set of For Life in character as Isaac Wright Jr, who was wrongfully convicted of being a drug kingpin in 1991.

Wearing a red prison jumpsuit, it’s clear that 50 has seriously bulked up.

In the caption, he revealed: ‘My New ABC show is intense,I filmed yesterday I’m still bugging. I gained 15 pounds for this role.’

Basically, he really suffers for his art and we salute him for it.
